results.title: When Harry met Sally...
results.creator_credit: Castle Rock Entertainment, Rob Reiner and Andrew Scheinman
results.brief_description: Infamous for it’s restaurant scene that provokes the, “I’ll have what she’s having” line, this romantic comedy written by Nora Ephron follows the slowly developing relationship between Harry Burns (Billy Crystal) and Sally Albright (Meg Ryan). Harry and Sally meet in the 1970’s when they share a car trip courtesy of a mutual friend. They never run out of things to say, and Harry sticks by his proclamation that men cannot be friends with attractive women. Over the course of the next 10 years, both of them fall in and out of love, grow closer as friends, and contemplate a romantic future together when they cross the boundary between friends and lovers in a moment of emotional weakness. This film provided played a pivotal role in the renaissance of modern romantic comedy, led by Nora Ephron who went on to be involved in films such as “Sleepless in Seattle” and “You’ve got mail”, both of which featured Meg Ryan in the romantic lead. Cast also includes Carrie Fisher and Bruno Kirby.

results.title: When a man loves a woman
results.creator_credit: Luis Mandoki, Touchstone Pictures, Jordan Kerner and Jon Avnet
results.brief_description: Family and marriage are put under threat when Alice’s (Meg Ryan) drinking becomes an addiction. Husband Michael (Andy Garcia), an airline pilot, is a perfectionist and finds it increasingly difficult to control his often reckless and neglectful wife. It takes an accident before Alice realises she has hit rock bottom and needs help. After attending a rehab clinic Alice finally returns home stronger, more independent and alcohol free but Michael, on the other hand, has problems adjusting to the new Alice. He prefers the needy and dependent wife. As the marriage begins to break down, Michael and Alice take the long and difficult road to recovery through counselling. Cast also includes Lauren Tom, Philip Seymour Hoffman, Tina Majorino, Mae Whitman, Ellen Burstyn.

results.title: What women want [DVD]
results.creator_credit: ICON, Paramount Pictures, Wind Dancer Productions, Centropolis Effects, Susan Cartonis, Bruce Davey, Gina Matthews, Nancy Meyers and Matt Williams
results.brief_description: Nick Marshall (Mel Gibson) is a real ladies man. Raised by his mother, a Las Vegas showgirl, he has a somewhat distorted perception of what women really want, and an enormous ego. When he is passed over for an executive position in the advertising agency for a woman his chauvinistic attitude worsens. A freak accident while trying to brainstorm ideas for a new advertising campaign, leaves Nick with the ability to hear what women think. Amazed by his new talent Nick seeks the help of a therapist (Bette Midler) who suggests he think of it as a gift and not a curse, and to use this to his advantage. Nick sets his sights on Darcy McGuire (Helen Hunt), the new creative director in the agency. At first his plan works, and he undermines Darcy at every opportunity, until he realises Darcy has feelings for him, and that he feels the same way about her. Cast also includes Marisa Tomei, Mark Feurstein, Lauren Holly, Valerie Perrine, Delta Bourke and Alan Alda.

results.title: What have I done to deserve this? = Que he hecho yo para merecer esto?
results.creator_credit: Tesauro S A, Kaktus S A, Tadeo Villabla and Pedro Almodovar
results.brief_description: Gloria is a housewife with attitude. She has to be: one son is a drug dealer, her youngest son is having an affair with the family dentist, her husband can’t excite her anymore, and her mother-in-law is determined to drive her crazy. To survive in the concrete jungle of Madrid, Gloria snorts cleaning powders and searches for sex with masculine strangers. This wickedly funny movie is an early feature by Almodovar and it revels in inverting and satirising the conventions of television soap opera and of the Hollywood “women’s film”. Absurd, fast-paced and stylistically innovative, “What Have I Done to Deserve This?” stars the fabulous Carmen Maura.

results.title: What Happened to Kerouac?
results.brief_description: This film is a fascinating portrait of Jack Kerouac, the author of “On the road” and reluctant King of the Beat Generation. Includes interviews with family members and cronies including Allen Ginsberg, William Burroughs and Edie Kerouac Parker. This film is a candid and moving biography of one of America’s most influential authors. It is a terrifying and exhilarating film about a troubled genius whose influence is still being felt all over the world.

results.title: What dreams may come
results.creator_credit: Interscope communications, PolyGram Filmed Entertainment, Metafilmics, Stephen Simon, Barnet Bain and Vincent Ward
results.brief_description: Annie (a painting conservator) and Chris (a paediatrician) barely recover after the tragic loss of their two children when Chris is fatally wounded in a car accident. Shortly afterwards he experiences life on the ‘other side’, aided by Albert (Cuba Gooding Jr), a spiritual guide who steers Chris through the psychological impediments that hinder acceptance of his death. When Annie commits suicide and goes to hell, Chris follows, risking his own eternal presence in heaven, to save her. “What dreams may come” won an Academy Award for its special effects but most critics found the film too preternaturally mawkish and sentimental to be taken seriously as a work that ponders the portentous issues of metaphysics and spirituality. Heaven is depicted as Impressionist paintings come to life; Hell is a vision akin to the horrific Gothic vision of Hieronymus Bosch. But impressive as the film’s aesthetics are, an over-reliance, indeed emphasis, on computer generated wizardry, robs it of any dramaturgical import. Additionally its over-determination to reunite the nuclear family stultifies any dramatic intentions and demands inordinate absurdity from the narrative.

results.title: What becomes of the broken hearted?
results.creator_credit: Sequel Productions, Bill Gavin and Ian Mune
results.brief_description: It’s five years from where “Once were warriors” left us, and Jake the Muss has turned his back on his family - breaking old habits is not as easy. His long suffering wife, Beth (Rena Owen), has left him and is living with someone new. Jake too has started a new relationship which is punctuated by violence and alcohol abuse. He is reunited with Beth and younger son, Sonny (Clint Eruera), at the funeral of Nig, who died in a gang fight. Tensions flare between Jake and Sonny, and as Sonny delves deeper into the dangerous world of gangs to gain retribution for his elder brother’s death, Jake must face, once and for all, the demons of the past and open up to the possibility of change, and survival.

results.title: What's up Doc?
results.creator_credit: Saticoy Productions, Warner Bros Pictures and Peter Bogdanovich
results.brief_description: Taking its cues from the classic 1930s screwball comedies of Howard Hawks and Preston Sturges, “What’s up Doc” is most reminiscent (more or less a remake) of “Bringing up Baby” (Hawks, 1938). Barbra Streisand plays the flighty university student Judy Maxwell, who has trouble deciding which course she is in, creating chaos wherever she goes with her free-spirited presence. After spying nerdy musicologist Howard Bannister (Ryan O’Neal), Judy decides they are a perfect match and sets her romantic sights on him. As per the genre, Howard has an equally nebbish fiancee, who is of course but a minor obstacle in the course of true love. The film scores lots of laughs with a series of mixed up suitcases, missing jewels, an extensive chase scene, and romantic interludes. “What’s up Doc?” manages a successful mix of rapid fire dialogue, physical comedy and charming lead performances, which made it one of the big hits of 1972, the second in a row for director Peter Bogdanovich (The Last Picture show, Paper moon, The Cat’s meow). Features several songs by Barbra Streisand.

results.title: What's eating Gilbert Grape?
results.creator_credit: Matalon Teper Ohlsson Production, J and M Entertainment, Meir Teper, Bertil Ohlsson, David Matalon and Lasse Hallstrom
results.brief_description: From the acclaimed director of “My life as a dog”, “What’s eating Gilbert Grape?” is a moving and at times comic portrayal of an unusual family in a small town. Gilbert (Johnny Depp) must keep a vigilant eye on his family, particularly his intellectually disabled younger brother Arnie (Leonardo Di Caprio) and his reclusive mother. When a stranger (Juliette Lewis) comes to town, she not only captures his heart, but also turns his life around.
